alert.note: Alert for Clay; Jackson; Laurel; Owsley; Pulaski; Rockcastle (Kentucky) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 07 at 11:18AM EDT by NWS Jackson
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of northwestern Laurel, west central Owsley, Pulaski, Jackson, Rockcastle and northwestern Clay Counties through 1145 AM EDT... At 1118 AM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from Locust Branch to 9 miles southwest of Liberty. Movement was southeast at 35 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Strong thunderstorms will be near... Brazil, Alcorn, Hisel, Kerby Knob, Sandgap, Collingsworth, Shirley and Clover Bottom around 1125 AM EDT. Foxtown and Waneta around 1130 AM EDT. McKee, Lakes, Turkey Foot, Macedonia and Bradshaw around 1135 AM EDT. Other locations in the path of these storms include New Zion, Privett, Gray Hawk, Atkinstown, Cains Store, Magnum, Green Hall, Sturgeon, Pointer, Elian, Faubush, Mummie, Stab and Nathanton. THIS INCLUDES THE FOLLOWING HIGHWAYS... Interstate 75 in east central Kentucky between mile markers 45 and 72. Kentucky Highway 80 in Pulaski County between mile markers 17 and 40. Louis B. Nunn Parkway MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Heavy rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.

area.areaDesc: Clay; Jackson; Laurel; Owsley; Pulaski; Rockcastle
